## Installation

You can install the released version of TidyDensity from [CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org) with:

``` r
install.packages("TidyDensity")
```

And the development version from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("spsanderson/TidyDensity")
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example}
library(TidyDensity)

tidy_normal()
tidy_beta()
tidy_gamma()
tidy_poisson()
```

An example plot of the `tidy_normal` data.

```{r plot_density}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

tn <- tidy_normal(.num_sims = 30)
tg <- tidy_gamma(.num_sims = 9)
tb <- tidy_beta(.num_sims = 5)
tp <- tidy_poisson()

tidy_autoplot(tn, .plot_type = "density")
tidy_autoplot(tg, .plot_type = "quantile")
tidy_autoplot(tb, .plot_type = "probability")
tidy_autoplot(tp, .plot_type = "qq")
```
